headline: Advanced Micro Devices: Solid AI Momentum, But Current Valuation Leaves Little Upside

headline: Why Are AMD (AMD) Shares Soaring Today
summary: Shares of computer processor maker AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) jumped 5% in the morning session after chip stocks rallied to start the week as investor optimism rose following trade discussions between U.S. and Chinese officials in London.

headline: AMD price target lift, Apple's WWDC, Chewy downgrade
summary: Market Domination co-host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock gains after Citi lifts its price target to $120 from $100, citing upcoming artificial intelligence (AI) catalysts and advantages over Nvidia (NVDA). Apple (AAPL) is kicking off its Worldwide Developers Conference on Monday, where the company is expected to unveil key software updates. Chewy (CHWY) stock slides after Mizuho downgraded the stock to Neutral from Outperform. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: AMD price target, Intuitive Surgical downgrade: Trending Tickers
summary: Citi analysts lifted their price target for Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to $120 from $100, highlighting potential positive catalysts in the second half of the year. Deutsche Bank downgraded Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) to Sell from Neutral and cut its price target for the company to $440. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Latest News In AI Chips - Alchip Expands Global Design Footprint in Vietnam and Japan
summary: Alchip Technologies is expanding its global design capabilities with new initiatives in Vietnam and Japan, underscoring its commitment to enhancing high-performance computing (HPC) and AI chip design capabilities. The company has opened new design centers in Da Nang and Hanoi, Vietnam, to leverage the skilled engineering talent prevalent in the region, while also expanding its Japan Design Center with a second office in Shin-Yokohama. These strategic expansions aim to address the increasing...

headline: Broadcom, Nvidia, and AMD Could Help This Unstoppable ETF Turn $250,000 Into $1 Million in 10 Years
summary: Data center spending could top $1 trillion per year by 2028 to meet surging demand for computing capacity driven by artificial intelligence (AI).  Suppliers of data center chips and components, such as Nvidia, Broadcom, and Advanced Micro Devices, could be poised for significant growth.  The iShares Semiconductor ETF holds those three stocks along with 27 others, and it could turn $250,000 into $1 million over the coming decade.

headline: AMD's Shopping Spree Continues. Is the AI Stock a Buy?
summary: AMD just acquired Brium, an AI software company.  The move follows several acquisitions in AI, including ZT Systems.  AMD (NASDAQ: AMD) might be the biggest sleeper stock in the artificial intelligence (AI) chip business right now.
